Reviews.Title: “More than adequate!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisnJacknjack
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 7 year old son, had a triple room on the 3rd floor with a balcony .Yes, the rooms are small but its only a place to sleep. The staff are very friendly, the place is clean, the breakfast is adequate. Contrary to the other reviews,we found the area to be quite acceptable and had an excellent meal in the Le Seadas restaurant nearby. The quiet location of the hotel is a bonus as you really need a good nights sleep after a day in Rome. The Metro is the best way to travel, quick and cheap. We would stay here again. One tip - buy your drinks from the nearby shops - 4 euro for a coke in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel,great staff”
Reviews.Author: panosrose
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Pinewood Hotel for 5 days on February. The hotel is dated and i am sure that was never renovated. The rooms are small and the bed is awful. The bathroom was clean and tidy. The breakfast is below zero. The reception staff was very helpful but the restaurant staff was the opposite. Location is also bad if you want to be near the center.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've reviewed”
Reviews.Author: HHIslander042
Reviews.Content: This is perhaps one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed. First of all it was not in a good area. Bums sleeping in park across the street, graffiti and such. The hotel service was awful, could not get a drink either night in the bar, as bartender also did many other duties. Front desk agent also was operator, so calls never got answered. Rooms were old, dirty and in disrepair.

Reviews.Title: “SANTA”
Reviews.Author: malvina13
Reviews.Content: The Hotel in not central located, but is only 10 minutes away (walk) from Cornelia metro station.The lobby was spatious and clean. My room was quiet, very clean and warm . The bed was very comfortble and linen and towels fresh. There was a buffet breakfast, good variety but no brown bread and fresh fruits. Staff was helpful, polite and english speaking.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: myownrutlandUK
Reviews.Content: Another late booking on Superbreak, very reasonably priced. Clean welcoming hotel, close to Metro and a couple of good restaurants.Lovely quiet room, (surprisingly as we were next to the lift, but heard nothing) well equipped with comfortable bed, good aircon /heating (really good as we stayed there when Rome was almost closed down with the snow and freezing temperatures) excellent service, very helpful staff, especially on Reception. Breakfast was good with varied buffet so you can eat as much or as little as you like All in all a very pleasant and reasonably priced break

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: NiknakDevon
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on lastminute.com for a very reasonable price. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from 'Cornelia' Metro station so access to all of Rome is very good. It is not in a particularly nice part of town.. Lots of graffiti and rubbish.. But the hotel itself is clean. Very basic but we had a comfortable stay for the four nights we were there. In my opinion the main down side was the bed was two singles pushed together to form a double which was a little uncomfortable having a gap in the middle of the bed!! The staff were very friendly and accommodating - my partner is gluten and wheat free but was advised by the man on reception to point this fact out to the breakfast waitress and she in turn provided him with gluten free options at breakfast. I know a lot of people have complained about the size of the bedrooms - as far as I'm concerned you get what you pay for! If you are just going to use the hotel as your base for exploring Rome then I'd say the size of the room and bathroom was perfect! The only time we spent in the hotel was to sleep at night, which after a long day of sightseeing the last thing on my mind was the size of the room! Plenty of wardrobe and shelf space. All in all, an ideal place to stay when visiting Rome as it's not right in the centre it is peaceful at night.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for price”
Reviews.Author: mamreilly
Reviews.Content: Pros: Friendly service, all you can eat breakfast that is well stocked, reasonable rates, close to metro lines (10 minute walk), park across the street with panoramic view of Rome. Cons: Small room (our room was one of the smallest), small bathrooms (even for European standards), high cost for internet access. We enjoyed our stay and would stay here again if we ever return to Rome. We arrived early (~8:00 am) and the manager allowed us to check in early. We stayed here for 7 days and 6 nights and enjoyed consistently excellent and friendly service from the day manager. All the beds in all the rooms are two twin beds. The "king" beds are just two twin beds pushed together with king sized sheets and king size comforters. Heat worked exceptionally well in the room.

Reviews.Title: “European sized rooms, a tad dated and unclean, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Androsmn
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights in a family room with four beds. A tight squeeze. Small bathroom with smaller shower compartment in bathtub. Walls were not the cleanest and breakfast was adequate and the same each day but hotel was a short walk to the bus lines and metro. Very convenient to get around the city. A real nice restaurant, Frankie's, close to hotel. Laundromat, drop off service, located close. Reception and staff very helpful and friendly. Spoke very good English. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Would have been nice to have stayed the full duration!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TheWebsters4
Reviews.Content: OK where do I start?!!! Arrived in Rome after a lovely flight with Jet2, to be told off by the transfer people!!! (consorzia - dont use them they are hopeless - make your own way to the hotel its very easy!). We arrived at Pinewood and greeted by a lovely receptionist - who as soon as we told her our names, she went straight onto make a phone call, we knew at this stage that something was very very wrong!!!! After she had finished on the phone we were told that the hotel was full and that they had thought we had cancelled our booking (still unsure why they thought that as it was part of a package deal with Thomas Cook and we were not told we had to reconfirm before we travelled). She did however offer to get a taxi to take us to a nearby hotel (it was absolutely throwing it down at this point). So..... we were told to come back in the morning (anytime???) and we would have a room for the night. So.... we got a taxi to a nearby hotel - when we arrived there we were told that they only had one room left and so we didnt have much of a choice here!... the room was the room that looked as though they had used it for guests to use as a 'shower room', it was so run down that we thought we were actually staying at the Colleseum! Nonetheless, we dropped our luggage and off we went to Rome - where we had a fabulous day sightseeing. We then went back to the Pinewood at 10.00 am, the other hotel told us we had to check in after 2pm but we had a trip booked at 12.00 noon so we had to take our luggage somewhere. Imagine our surprise when we arrived and they told us our room was ready!!!! considering the check out time is 11.00 am - maybe our suspicious minds told us something was not quite right! Anyway... they had tried to redeem themselves by being very helpful and leaving us a bottle of red wine (not sure if that was standard or not, but was very nice!). The hotel overall is very nice - you get what you pay for and the breakfast although a little boring was sufficient. Its on the the main route into the centre of Rome (Bus 49) and you can get around very cheaply - 1 euro per ticket or 4 euros for a pass. Dont let this put you off as we were quite happy with what we got (eventually!) but I would recommend phoning the hotel to confirm before you fly! Oh and as said previously if you can make your own way to the airport then do, as the transfer company were over an hour late, even though we had been told the day before what time they would be coming... luckily the driver drove like Lewis Hamilton and we just made it - although we werent seated together! Rome is unbelievable, its cheap to eat in the right places and we had a lovely weekend. Be extra vigilant with your belongings and you will be fine, we had no trouble at any time and there are plenty of police around at the main sights..... enjoy xx

Reviews.Title: “four star hotel - best for family”
Reviews.Author: romolo2009
Reviews.Content: traveling with my family ( 2 adults and 2 children) to Rome by car we booked at this four star hotel a family room (sitting room with 2 beds, sleepping room with a bath room with jacuzzi bath-room. we could park our car at the hotel parking place free of charge and went to the city center by subway. Cornelia station was at only 400 mt. and from there in few stops we were at the spanish steps and from there on we can visit the city by walking. the hotel staff was very friendly and professional. the room was clean and comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: seasonedtraveller063
Reviews.Content: We were staying as part of a package and checked in by unsmiling hotel staff. The location is well out of Rome but handy for the metro Our room was minute, the bathroom was "tired" and the shower was awful, the cubicle was very small (a fat person would struggle to get in) with a creaking plastic tray and dodgy temperature control, it either poached or froze. Breakfast was uninspiring and the bar prices were astronomical e.g. 10 euros for a G&T This hotel definitely does not deserve a four star rating, two star is more appropriate.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Bruce M
Reviews.Content: Many of the comments already made seem valid. The rooms are perfectly adequate for a hotel of acceptable quality although 4 stars are awarded when three might be more appropriate. A major oddity is that - despite having a fully capable kitchen and staff - no evening meal is generally available and guests have to make their way down the road to two other restaurants, each the best part of half a kilometre distant. Travel into the city is best done by metro from Cornelia station : all the No. 49 buses I saw were packed. My room had some strange bathroom fittings : a toilet of very unusual design and a basin that required reaching underneath in order to release the drain plug! But the place is quiet, the staff are charming and helpful and it's a good place to come back to after a hard day of sight-seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: justinabrgss
Reviews.Content: The location was not ideal .The room very basic but clean .The breakfast was okay .The 4 star rating was misleading .

Reviews.Title: “really nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dahzeeh
Reviews.Content: Yes, the rooms are a bit small, but everything in this hotel is good! The staff is welcoming, rooms are confortable, it's pretty well located (near buses and metro), breakfast is good (not excellent though). I would stay here again if i had to come back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good Sized Rooms for Four”
Reviews.Author: SKrishnan2011
Reviews.Content: We were travelling through Europe and our point of entry was Rome. We checked into Pinewood after a long flight from Australia. A family with teenage children we booked into a quadruple room which was clean with excellent bathroom. However room service was minimal. With hungry teenage children we found that difficult. We finally walked about 10 minutes near Cornelia to eat each day. The train station is a ten minute walk, which when you have been walking all day seems a trek, especially on long days .. on hindsight will choose to stay close to Rome Termini next trip...

Reviews.Title: “Good, 1KM walk to underground”
Reviews.Author: benion
Reviews.Content: Good, 1KM walk to underground, clean hotel good food, very helpful, and parking

Reviews.Title: “Very Rude Lobby Staff”
Reviews.Author: hersmineours
Reviews.Content: First let me just say we were so mis-led. We spoke to the hotel and read the reviews to see how it was and what the rooms were like. We needed a suite to hold 5 people. They said their suites were large and would be comfortable. My closet was bigger than this so called suite. A suite must have a different meaning in Rome than in the USA. The sad part here was that we were tripping all over our luggage and could not even open it up for lack of space. We also asked that there be a refrigerator hooked up and cool by the time we got there for medical reasons. There was no fridge. Not only did it take them a while to get one but it never even got cool the three days we were there. The lobby staff was very rude. I waited at the counter for 10 minutes while 2 employees argued with one another to ask for a fridge. I ended up leaving and just calling down. They answered the phone in the lobby they just did not acknowledge a real person standing in front of them. What gives? The man with the black hair and facial hair was the rudest! On our last day at this hotel, going off to our cruise, my husband went to check out with him, my husband said we were checking out, he nodded. We waited in the lobby for about an hour with all our luggage by us. More space there than in the room. When the limo arrived we went outside to pack up and leave. As our bags were being loaded he comes running out and said we had not checked out and that there were additional charges. The extra charges were the tax. Clearly not a very observant person. I wish I saw his name tag. The one saving grace here was the continental breakfasts. Those were decent and offered a variety of food items. For the record, I would not go back. The beds were hard as a rock and the linens looked as old as the Colosseum.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT RECOMMEND - horrible, false advertisement”
Reviews.Author: AMinhas88
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the so called "4-Star" hotel but it was more like a 1 star hotel. When we got there found out our rooms were on the 5th and 6th floor, the lift which takes you up hardly holds more than 2 people, very small tight space. We had booked 2 rooms, the rooms were very small, hardly any walking space. The sofa beds for the third person had such thin mattresses and throughout the night the metal bars could be felt, it was very uncomfortable, the carpet hadn't been hoovered, the side tables by the bed were covered in dust. The tv was so small and only had a few Italian channels on it. But the worst was the bathroom, the shower was so small, hardly one child could fit in there, forget an adult showering in it, once you were in there was no way of moving about, felt trapped in it. In one room the bathroom ceiling was coming down in 2 places and one of the spotlights were hanging down. In one of the rooms there was a painting which was wet and covered in fungus underneath the glass cover. When I went down to complain the night we got there, there was no staff there who understood English, I was very rudely asked to come back when the manager was in the next morning. We had no option but to stay that night, it was after midnight and we had 4 more nights booked there. In the morning I spoke to manager and very unhelpfully said that sorry we cant help, no other rooms are available. I then showed the photos of the rooms and bathrooms up on the hotels website and said this is what i wanted as this is what is shown, and he said that sorry that is only the first floor rooms that are like that because have been refurbished, but the rest haven't been. HOWEVER on the website it says all the 80 rooms have been refurbished!!!!! Then we had no option but to leave that morning and book elsewhere into a proper 4 star hotel, which was a proper hotel. This wasted the first day of our holiday. I WOULD DEFINITELY NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL TO ANYONE.

Reviews.Title: “can do better”
Reviews.Author: jokawins
Reviews.Content: Travelling with Travelsphere, we were allocated room 309. 1, The reception, (which also held seating and the bar area). This was clean and well arranged/organised. I would suggest that the seating was not something you were supposed to relax on. The bar drinks were very expensive (ie..6 Euro for a bottle fo Becks). Access to rooms was by 2 lifts..both working or a good & well lit staircase. 2, Our room, was small, approx 3x4mts (we were told that they are all small?). It was adequate for our needs, and held twin beds, clothes storage and a safe at no extra cost, however the view from the window was straight into some residential flats...our curtains needed to stay closed. The bathroom was a better size, with all the reqmts (it did provide a hairdryer) you could expect for that facilty. 3, Meals wre taken as breakfast only, what we had offerred was good enough (continental style, with cerals/fruit, cakes, tea/coffee/juice from machine).. 4, Hotel location, Situated on a busy road and pretty remote from any real places to go at night. We did locate two bars and a good local Italian restaurant. Go out ofthe hotel, immediately turn right and right again, walk about 200metrs and see the first bar. Leaving there as iof going back to the hotel, tunr right walk about 500metres see next bar on left. Leave there onto the mai street again, and walking left after about 500metres find th restaurant. Good food, friendly people, and they helped us with the translation, hasle frre and good food..starter/main course/sweet, bottle of wine, 50 Euros (good vakue for Italy).

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay here again - excellent”
Reviews.Author: GilKar1944
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four. We found the Pinewood through trip advisor. It was one of the few hotels with a high excellence rating. We are inexperienced travelers and always have fears of winding up in a place that is not family friendly. I am happy to report that this hotel exceeded our expectations, both in friendliness and service. The bus stops right in front of the hotel, the metro is about a 10 minute walk. We used the metro exclusively to get around because it is much faster than the bus which stops every few blocks. Good breakfast, pleasant room, quiet. Easy access to all the sights in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel just outside the city centre.”
Reviews.Author: Fletchlj
Reviews.Content: We have very recently got back from our 5 day holiday to Rome. The hotel was exactly as we expected, clean with spacious comfortable rooms. It is 10 stops on the metro from termini the central train station (on metro line A). The metro is fantastic and it is very easy to get in to the city. A 4€ card let's you travel freely on the metro all day on both line a and line b (for access to the colosseum etc.) The walk to the metro station is around 10mins. The advantages of being out of the centre are that the rates for this hotel given it is a 4* are very attractive. Similarly the restaurants in the local area are a fraction of the cost compared to the more touristy spots and they serve great food which the locals eat. You should try the place near aurelia, it's just over the crossing past mcdonalds on the left hand side. All on all a lovely friendly hotel close to the Vatican with easy access to the centre. Thanks for a fab time!!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but horrible location”
Reviews.Author: chai5
Reviews.Content: Booked this through Hotwire for a great rate but blind to the location. We only needed it for a one night stopover but we did have a full day to explore. The hotel itself was fine. The location was however, simply put, awful. This was a working class neighborhood so no real amenities for a traveller and not even local shops close by. 15 minutes walk to the subway and then 20 minutes on the subway. When we asked for a local restaurant location there were only 2 choices if we didn't want a cab ride. I guess if you measure from the perimeter of whatever circle is considered central we got what we asked for.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T DO IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: cjfry
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awful! The manager was an absolute jerk. The location is WAY far away from everything and it is not easy to get around. The neighborhood looks like a 3rd world country. Found a GREAT hotel right in downtown that had great service and was nicer and more reasonably priced than this one. Just don't stay here it is THAT BAD!!!

Reviews.Title: “By far my best stay in Europe yet!”
Reviews.Author: Stephaniejoy2481
Reviews.Content: I'm an 18 year old girl from Australia traveling alone, very cautious about where I choose to stay for obvious reasons. When I walked into the pinewood though it was very welcoming despite not speaking Italian! The staff were lovely, informative and friendly. The rooms were clean and comfortable at a RIDICULOUSLY cheap price! Especially for the location. I only stayed 3 nights and the only downfall would be my noisy neighbors! But otherwise I couldn't fault the hotel if I ever return to Rome I'm definitely stating here again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Tidy and Spacious Room”
Reviews.Author: ian-griffiths
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 26th to 29th May and were very pleased with the hotel as the cost was reasonable. The rooms were very spacious and clean and tidy. We had a lovely balcony with our room so that we could sit out in the evening. The location isn't perfect but in less than 10 minutes you can walk to a tube stop and be on the direct line for everywhere you need to go in Rome. There is no food sold in the hotel in the evening but you can order a take away and have it delivered at a very reasonable cost. Overall it was a very nice hotel and if returning to Rome we wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Only 1 minor complaint, pillow was to lumpy”
Reviews.Author: SallyW1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our city break in Rome. Location , quick to city. Front desk very helpful. Very clean, lovely jacuzzi bath well needed after a walking day in Rome. Will return to the hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Pinewood”
Reviews.Author: Emmy_e2002
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the hotel was worth the price. The staff at the reception were very helpful and recommend it to anyone. We were shown a resturant that we can have our meals during the day. The TV in the room was quite small and I can't remember the last time I saw such a TV. Apart from that we had a great time staying there though most of the day we were always out sightseeing. If we visit again we would definitely use them again

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: deb8407
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel early and was able to check into our rooms. We had two rooms on the 3rd floor, both were clean and comfortable, bathroom small but had a bath and shower with complimentary toiletries. Staff at front desk very informative and helpful. Bus stop outside hotel, catch the number 49 and it takes you to outside the Vatican museum or stay on for another stop to St Peters, on return bus drops off outside hotel. Bus journey takes approx 20 minutes. Breakfast at hotel was good, cereals and yogurt, bread buns and crispbreads, cheese and cold meat, jams and honey along with delicious pastries. Bottled water, juice or tea or coffees - perfect start to your day! Although we had rooms at front of hotel you did hear some traffic noise but nothing to worry us. On checking out they had a room available to leave our luggage, on return we had coffee and offered pastries. Would have no hesitation in stoping at Pinewood hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Europe_lover1234
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in 4 stars Pinewood Hotel with a family of 7. Booked a triple room as well as a quadruplet room which we have been offered two small double rooms. Rooms were clean and reasonable sized. Breakfast was so so. Location is in reasonable convenience with bus tranfer to/from the Metro station. Rita the receptionist was well spoken in english and was very kind and helpful. Certainly very good value for money..

Reviews.Title: “Impressed in Rome”
Reviews.Author: 1europe
Reviews.Content: I and my family (group of 7) booked 3 rooms in this beautiful hotel for 2 nights. We were very impressed with the hotel. The breakfast buffet was delicious and our rooms were spacious and comfortable. The water pressure was excellent and the A/C was very comfotable in the hot summer. The subway is a 15 minute walk from the hotel and for 1 Euro you can take the train downtown to go on the Hop on Hop off sightseeing tour or visit any of the sights yourself. The Airport pickup coach passes by this hotel and the hotel also provides pick and drop to the Airport for about 60 Euros. I would recomend this hotel to anyone wanting to see Rome while staying in a quiet neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Had everything we were looking for.”
Reviews.Author: julianp-uk
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at this hotel for one night, arriving late and leaving early as part of a two day trip to Rome, however it had everything we needed, on the outskirts of the city with parking (we drove) but close to a Metro station and having rooms that provided multiple occupancy. Overall we were happy with the hotel, the reception was modern and pleasant and all members of staff were friendly and helpful – particularly the reception staff. The rooms were clean though showing a little sign of wear and tear which I guess is to be expected. There’s a flat screen TV, power shower in the bathroom but couldn’t find a mini-bar. The multi occupancy rooms have a bed-settee in a room that can be separated by sliding doors so the overall room is kind of a suite. This gave space for four people, though I hear some rooms can accommodate up to five people. Breakfast was OK with drinks, cereals, breads and croissants etc, parking is free out the front of the hotel and there is a bar in reception though it was closed by the time we arrived. Nearest metro station (Cornelia) is about 15 minutes walk which takes you direct into the city for 1 Euro, or buy a day ticket for 4 Euros. Rome is absolutely dripping in big sights, history and culture, expect queues at the major attractions such as the coliseum and Vatican (queue was far smaller for the Vatican in the afternoon). We looped the city on the topless bus to get a grounding and then used it to get from sight to sight. We had been warned by the hotel staff to watch out for distraction thieves and pick pockets etc as I hear it can be a problem though we saw nothing and you just need to be a little vigilant as you would in any large city that has a large number of tourists. We travelled on the metro and walked back from the station around midnight as a family and felt safe. Also, just in case you’re not aware the metro map looks quite impressive but there are only two actual metro lines giving an X route over the city, other lines are either tram or bus that jostle with the traffic. So overall, hotel not the Ritz but OK for the price, Rome a hectic vibrant city that you could explore all week.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: touristTelAviv
Reviews.Content: the room is very clean and elegant. there is a 10 minutes walk to the nearest metro station - not so bad. there is a free parking wich is rare in rome. the wi-fi cost 3 euro for hour- expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean hotel. The price was great!”
Reviews.Author: Maria2010187286
Reviews.Content: I read majority of the tripadvisor reviews before booking this hotel. Overall, Pinewood Hotel is clean and serves good, free breakfast. The staff were very friendly and the map the hotel provided was very helpful. The room was small however we did not mind because we were there to sleep only. My sister and I left during the day to see all tourist attractions. During our four days of vacation, we took the metro because we were not sure of the bus schedule plus we do not speak Italian (only English). The metro train is very convenient and operates past midnight on weekends. The location (Cornelia) itself is not that great but if you enjoy walking and want to save money, I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Large enough room for family - good value for Rome”
Reviews.Author: njoyurkidz
Reviews.Content: A bit difficult to find. Staff was helpful. Room was a good size. Appreciated the breakfast. room had an odd odor. Overall, it was a good stay and I felt like it was a decent v alue for a family with 2 young teens.

Reviews.Title: “a perfect choice for a big, noisy, expensive, yet wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: VisitorIsrael
Reviews.Content: 1. Very helpful team 2. Nice cosy rooms. 3. Great bath with Jaccuzi 4. Don't expect much of breakfast. 5. Best value hotel for Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Twelve Nights in late September. All good”
Reviews.Author: OntarianSenior
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pinewood for 12 nights in late September 2009. Made the selection after reading lots of reviews on Trip Advisor. As usual we have to look at the great picture when reading these reviews, as there are always some frustrated and difficult travelers out there.Picking an hotel in the top 35% has served us good at all times around the world.Pinewood Hotel was no exception. Reception was excellent. Spoke English and French with no problems. Nice lobby for a medium size hotel. Elevators are small, typical of many smaller places in Europe, but fonctioned well.With two elevators, practically no waiting time Our room on the third floor, at the front of the hotel was quite acceptable for European standards.Even had a small balcony with chairs and table facing a large park across the street. Room not large but clean, a bath with an excellent shower with plenty of hot water at all time .Flat screen TV with a few English CNN, BBC and Fench, TV5 .stations We slept very well on the harder than "we're used to" beds.Quiet place even if there were tours like Insight Vacations, Globus etc staying at the hotel.These tours being there is a a good reference to choose this hotel. Serve yourself breakfasts were very good. Sorry no toasts, just croissants and rolls.Good selection of coffee,juices,fruits,cereals,yogurt,buns and plenty of tables. This hotel is well located if you tour with a car, ample parking. For the others,busses are frequent right in front of the hotel, and less than 10 minutes walk to the excellent Metro/subway system. Within 3 minutes left of the hotel , there is a market. Near the Metro station turn left and within 5 minutes you'll find "corner pizzerias" with a good selectiion of other buffet syle food for a much better price. The hotel referred limo to the Airport was a bit pricey but we felt like big shots in the big black Mercedez. From the Airport to the Hotel, do not hesitate to book "Viator" shuttle. Best price , good service and hotel Pinewood is the first stop (in our case) to drop customers to their hotels. Booked on the internet prior to leaving home Conlusion: Good value , good stay and good holiday . Ciao ! OntarianSenior

Reviews.Title: “Allow extra time to the city centre”
Reviews.Author: markotto
Reviews.Content: In general I expected more of this hotel because it was a 4 star hotel. Clean room. Small lifts. And it takes 10 min by bus to the closest station and then 25 mins to reach to the city centre. The area around the hotel didn't offer that much in fact nothing. No restaurants, no nothing. The Breakfast was the best part of all. After paying the tariff that was not cheap, we had to pay for the internet access as well. Average hotel, far from the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Questionable at best!”
Reviews.Author: kjconner
Reviews.Content: This hotel, as many of the other reviewers have pointed out, is NOT 4 star! The best way to describe it is "bare minimum". I traveled there with a group so I can't really associate a cost with it, but it offered nothing but a bed and a meager breakfast. The airline had lost the entire groups luggage "temporarily" and by the time it arrived my packed clothes were really wrinkled. This 80 room hotel had not even one single iron for it's patrons to use. Nothing like visiting St. Peters looking like a frumpy mess! Thanks for nothing! More importantly, on one morning my mother and I awoke and realized we never received our wake-up call. As we made our way down to breakfast (in the basement) we noticed the elevator wasn't working either. After breakfast, as we were standing in the lobby, the reception desk apologized and stated that both problems were due to a small fire they'd had that morning. He pointed to a wall outlet in the bar that had a smoke stain along the wall above it. At that point I cared nothing about the wake-up call or the elevator...where the heck are the smoke/fire alarms and sprinklers??????????

Reviews.Title: “Beware: This is NOT a Four Star Property”
Reviews.Author: jdr27
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on Hotwire, which was sold as a four star property. In a dreadful area in the northwest of Rome, the only thing worse than the location was the condition of the hotel itself. Dreary and run down are the best terms to describe it. My room, which had no functioning air conditioning nor wireless internet signal was basically useless. I immediately checked out and moved to a real four star property, The Pulitzer. Hotwre users beware: if you see a four star property in 'Rome Northwest', it is likely the Pinewood, and avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money but a little far from the centre”
Reviews.Author: pinkmich
Reviews.Content: It took me and my partner a while to find the hotel as the map seemed to show different. However once we had found it we were greeted warmly by the staff on arrival. We had an overall comfortable room with air-con, the bath could have been cleaned a little better though. The breakfast was sufficient, nice crossiants but no hot food, nothing too special. One fo the downsides is that the hotel is fairly out of the centre, therefore we had to have a 10-15min walk to the metro, then another 15 min trip on the metro to get to where we wanted to in the centre. Therefore we stayed out for the whole day, which was tiring especially for all the excitement of Rome, it would have been nice if we could of popped back to the hotel for a little rest if it was in the centre. If you cross the road from the hotel in to the park area opposite, you can have an interesting view, being able to see St Peters. Overall it was good value for money especially for the short few days we were staying for but be prepared to have to trip into the centre of it all each day.

Reviews.Title: “On the outskirts with value for money”
Reviews.Author: 643amc
Reviews.Content: The 4 star rating of this hotel is misleading , it could be , but it is not , for various reasons.I think that there are two hotels in Via Pineta Sacchetti ..but not sure ? I usually stay in 4 star hotels when travelling on business and this hotel is not 4 star . I opted to stay here even after reading the bad reviews , since I wanted to keep the costs reasonably low, for my family trip . The staff service is good and the rooms I had are clean ,even if the bathrooms , like all hotels in Rome, are difficult to squeeze into . I could barely lie down in the Jacuzzi bath, since it was only about 4 foot long. There is a good bus service from outside the hotel , bus 49 , which goes past the Metro at Corneli , past the Vatican and then to Piazza Cavour , every 14 minute till midnight . The area near the Metro is not nice to be late at night , even if my stay was uneventful . The breakfast was good for a three star but poor for a four star , plentiful but not up to standard . Quality of food should be considered, the cheapest brands are not suitable for 4 star hotels ....even if I eat them and am pleased with the taste and standard . I enjoyed my stay , as a seasoned traveller and used the buses a lot . I would like to recommend the good advise I was given by Salvatore de Luca at reception .

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: mytravel73
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via lastminute.com as one of their 'secret hotels'. We had reasonable expectations given that it was rated as a four-star hotel and they had very nice photos on their website. On arrival we were horrified. They gave us a room which was filthy and the bathroom was so pokey that we had to squeeze pass the toilet bowl to get into the shower! Being a slim person I could just about fit inside the shower. I don't know what other 'more rounder' people would have done. The room that they assigned to us stunk so badly of smoke that I think even smokers would have felt sick. My wife got several insect bites in the space of 15 minutes suggesting a problem with fleas (unusually for a mediterranean hotel they had carpets everywhere). Interestingly the receptionist seemed friendly on arrival until we explained our concerns in the calmest manner possible. At that stage he became very defensive and even lied to lastminute.com saying that we didn't want to stay in the hotel because we wanted to be nearer our parents (completely false as we ended up staying on the other side of Rome). Do not trust the photos on their website! - they are totally misleading, especially those of the rooms. The location was average - about 20 minutes walk from the nearest Metro. The area seemed a little squalid too. This is the worst four-star hotel I have ever seen!

Reviews.Title: “Very Treacherous”
Reviews.Author: redskins2971
Reviews.Content: I have one question for the hotel rating system in Italy... How in the world is the Pinewood Hotel a 4 star hotel?!?!?! From top to bottom the hotel was awful. The entrance seemed like a chaotic and filthy fountain running for no reason. Once you get into the lobby, It's still OK till that point. The receptionist was helpful though. Once you get to the room itself, that's when things get messy. Very small, filthy, and outdated room. I personally thought I was going to get a steal because it was rated as a "four star hotel" and the reviews were good. But it turns out that the hotel was equal to hell. It is about 15 minutes away from Central Rome once you take a taxi, metro, or bus. The surrounding of this hotel is also very unpleasant. Overall, very disappointed and had to literally look for another option for hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in a peaceful location”
Reviews.Author: Londoner1975
Reviews.Content: I have stayed 2 nights at this hotel early July. My room was on the upper floor with a fantastic view over the Pinewood just outside the hotel. The room was clean and really spacious. The staff was so friendly and always ready to help with directions or just happy to chat and making me feel welcome. Journey by bus to the city centre is about 15 minutes, so not too bad! I recommend this hotel, really good value and nice and peaceful location.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic place this is what rome is all about”
Reviews.Author: kennywalter
Reviews.Content: what a great place travelled here with my wife and older daughters with Trafalgar tours nice and clean nice rooms very friendly staff they could not do enough for you maybe not the closest hotel to the city but it was no problem on a bus which can be caught every 2 mins outside the hotel cant say enough really nice nice nice

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel/service for the price”
Reviews.Author: LifeRUs
Reviews.Content: We (husband, wife and one child) stayed at the Pinewood Hotel for 8 days. Was a bit apprehensive of the location so used the airport shuttle service for 45 Euros and was there in a little over 15 minutes. You can also take the train (x2) for about 12 Euros each but I would not recommend this option if you have a lot of luggage or traveling with small children. First impression of the hotel was not good as the outside is not very desirable nor is the surrounding area. This however changes once you enter the lobby. Our room was clean and a good size with 2 bedrooms, bathroom and patio. It was also air conditioned which is a plus in Rome. The Continental breakfast was excellent and gave us a great daily start. The best part of this hotel was the staff. They were helpful, directed us to many local tourist free places and assisted with making rental car and EuroRail reservations as we do not speak Italian. Much to our surprise, many of them refused to accept our offered tips. This hotel is outside the main tourists areas but the metro was a short walk away and we were only a few stops from everything we wanted to see. Our only suggestion for travelers is to ensure you have dinner where ever you are as once you return to the hotel, your options are fairly limited. Great Hotel! Great Service! Great Staff!

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay At Right Price!!”
Reviews.Author: SwapnaMurari
Reviews.Content: We were there in rome for 3 days...and we had reserved this hotel based in reviews in trip advisor..this was our first ever trip to Italy so were a bit apprehensive...we reached the hotel directly from the airport by a taxi.. and were charged around 50 euros..there was train option too which would had been much cheaper :)...as we were not sure of the place..opted for the taxi..it was around 11:00 Am by the time we reached ... receptionist there was very friendly and helpful gave us all the required information regarding the subways and places to see.as .the check in time was 12:00 noon so had to leave the luggage in the hotel(was safe)..would take 10 mins walk to the subway station...and Vatican city was the nearest place from hotel(2 stops) so we covered that area first...as soon as we returned the room was ready and we checked in...room was clean was much better than we expected...tidy bathroom as well..room service was also good..they changed towel etc every day.and coming to the break fast.they served continental breakfast the pictures must best describe them.....read few reviews saying ..was far away from central rome...but reaching central rome was never a problem..we took 3 day travel pass(11 Euros)..and could reach all the places within minutes!!.all and all a very good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “we felt very welcome”
Reviews.Author: rBMcine
Reviews.Content: It was our second trip back to Rome and we could not have been more happy. The Pinewood is located around 25 minutes from the airport and is located on the west side of the city close to bus line. We were checked in by Rita, who despite us being quite early could not have been more kinder and welcoming. She made our stay very pleasant. The rooms are clean and cool and appreciated the included breakfast. We will be booking here on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Roman Retreat..”
Reviews.Author: YouGetMe
Reviews.Content: A delightful hotel with fantastic service and an enjoyable stay for three nights. About ten minutes walk from Cornelia station, the hotel is a quiet retreat away from the hustle and bustle of Rome. The room was in a great condition and had all of the things you would expect from a hotel. However did lack a tea and coffee making facilities.. Giuseppe was a fantastic member of staff who helped us plan our routes and gave us a few pointers on where to go and through which routes. The room had a jacuzzi bath which was nice after a long days walking and touring.. There is nothing really in Cornelia or near the hotel in terms of restaurants. There is a bar within 5 mins and the "Golden Arches" are a further 10 minute walk for all you dirrty people!! Overall, would stay there again. Its only 11 Euros for a three day travelcard and that gets you around the city with ease. Cornelia is on Line A of the metro and is the penultimate stop en route to Battistini (north of the line). Ottaviano (Vactican) is only 4-5 stops away so it really is near the vatican and to town. Would recommend to anyone who would like to stay in a quiet hotel in Rome. Bellisimo!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Chrisroch
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a trip to Rome. We spent 6 nights at the Pinewood. It was a great deal! The rooms were very clean and tidy. The staff (most of our experience was with the front desk-Rita and Guiseppe) were terrific. They spoke great English and were very friendly and helpful. It was about a 10 min. walk to metro. It was kind of nice to escape the craziness of the center of Rome. We only ate in the neighborhood the last night and it seems they only recommend Seadas and saw many other people from the hotel however, the resturant was great! It was nice to eat in an authentic Italian restuarant vs the tourists trap ones in Rome. They were very friendly and it seemed to be family owned. The beds were big and pretty comfy. We would recommend this hotel to others. Breakfast was a typical continental breakfast but was adequate and nice to have!

Reviews.Title: “We will return!”
Reviews.Author: norrismj
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in quadruple room with two teenage children. Room was small but comfortable. Staff were friendly and very helpful. Desk staff spoke excellent English. Good continental breakfast included in the price. The hotel is located about half a mile from Cornelia Metro station which has very regular trains to all of the tourist spots. Cornelia is a dump but don't be put off by it when you first go to the hotel. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, great location... I cannot recommend highly enough!”
Reviews.Author: TAydin
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my partner at Pinewood over the valentines weekend and we both loved it! The staff were friendly & helpful, full of recommendations for restaurants & best places to visit other then the normal tourist hotspots. After our long days out the jacuzzi tub was a well needed treat at the end of the day. Even with our lack of knowledge of Rome the hotel location made travelling around Rome so simple, we never required a taxi once! I will definitely be staying at Pinewood whenever I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “very nice indeed”
Reviews.Author: nysingle
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel after seeing all the positive reviews, and I was not disappointed. The hotel is a great value. The price (about 100 usd/nite) was good for Rome. The room was small but quite comfortable (avg size for Europe), with a big bathroom (my tub was a Jacuzzi). They had wiFi with middle-of-the-road prices and a computer in the lobby (wasn't working while I was there). There was a nice small bar, and the staff were very helpful (I asked for something everyday). The breakfast was good (good scrambled eggs, pastries) except for the juice machine (watery). The location wasn't a problem for me via public transportation. It is a 10-15 minute walk to the station, and a 10-15 minute ride to Termini. So, despite the fact that the hotel is on the periphery of Rome, access was not a problem at all. When you get off the Cornelia station, you need to walk south toward the park (or total darkness if you're arriving at night) and the hotel will be on your left. The park was nice, esp. in the morning. The hotel is quiet, despite its approx. to the main road, and away from the crowds. There are some services near the train station. The pizza place was delicious (green "pizza kebab" sign). The restaurant next to the pizza place also seemed to be good (it was often packed), but I didn't eat there. As opposed to many hotels in Italy, it was more expensive to book directly than via Expedia / Orbitz, so check those sites out when you book the hotel. All in all, a very nice hotel, a great value, wonderful staff

Reviews.Title: “Out of town but great value”
Reviews.Author: Diptych
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Pinewood on the first evening of our trip to Umbria. The hotel is located to the West of The Vatican on a hill overlooking Rome. It is easy to reach off the GRA (ring road) and is conveniently close to the metro and bus routes for the centre of town. There is a large car park. The hotel is modern and clean and the rooms are spacious. There is no pool (which is a shame as this would make a real difference). However, staff are friendly and helpful and there is a great breakfast including proper scrambled egg! Now we have found the hotel I am sure that we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Great location, Fantastic Rome”
Reviews.Author: StevieGl
Reviews.Content: Transfered from Waldorf Hotel due to a problem ( Waldorf handled it very well, arranged taxi and apologised, arranged 2 night stay at the Pinewood). Have to say we were very pleased as the hotel is set in a lovely quiet area only 10 mins stroll to Cornelia metro and then 10 mins into Vatican and another 10 mins into Termini. Great room, very clean and well equiped with lovely bathroom. Even after a very hectic day seeing the sights of Rome the hotel was a very welcome sight when we returned and had a great night sleep and set for the next day. Comfy beds and very quiet allow for a relaxing time... Seriously reccomend this as my wife and I had a fantastic time... Forget central Rome, expensive prices, noisy roads, people making noise...spend a little time to travel and enjoy the Pinewood Hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: markbbk
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean and tidy which is approximately 10 minutes walk from the metro. This is an ideal location for staying in Rome if you do not want to pay the expensive prices of central Rome. The bar in the hotel was expensive but there are plenty of local bars and resaurants which are very reasonable. When you come of the metro the easyest way to find the hotel is to look for the pine wood trees and walk towords them , hence the name of the hotel. We spent 2 night before are cruse family room for two adults and 2 teens 16, and13. This room had 2 seperate bedroms 1 double and two singles.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, safe and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: SunloverDarwin
Reviews.Content: My 2 daughters and I spent 3 nights at the Pinewood during a European trip. I picked the hotel based on previous reviews on Tripadvisor and was not disappointed. The hotel staff were very helpful, the room was exactly as described and the breakfast was very good. The location is a bit out of the centre but there is easy access to buses and metros and also plenty of local shopping. We bought hop on hop off metro/bus passes for 4 Euros per day and had a great time. A similar quality of hotel would have been double the price nearer the city centre. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but not too bad”
Reviews.Author: Sid_The_Gunner
Reviews.Content: We booked our visit quite late and this was the only hotel we could get at a reasonable price. The rooms are quite small and basic but is clean and nice. It also had air-conditioning which is a bonus in the summer. Staff are very friendly and are very knowledgeable and will provide you with a map of Rome and direct you as best way to get around. Location is ok. About a 10 min walk to the metro station which is one before last stop on the 'A' line. But if you plan to stay out in the centre of Rome ie a restaurant it can be a right pain to get back as public transport stops early (plus the bus just did not turn up) and taxis are pretty hard to get hold of. Breakfast is a good continental breakfast with pastries bread juice etc. Restaurant is a no go in the evening and did not enjoy it at all. In summary if you book early and can stay closer to the city centre then do it but if you must stay here its not that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable and Smart”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelGod
Reviews.Content: Went with a school group of 18. Normaly they wouldn't allow this but the teacher explained we were a quiet and sensible group so they let us stay. An 8 mins. approx. walk to Cornelia tube station which is great to get to the centre of the city. A week metro card was 16 Euros i think for unlimited travel on buses n metro. We only had breakfast in the hotel which was all you can eat. This was very good quality good food and the coffees were great and just what you needed for lots of walking around Rome for the whole day. The rooms were comfortable and an average size with good sanitary facilities. Not much bad to say about the rooms apart from the views were not to 'Mrs. Richards' standard (Fawlty Towers!), mainly tower blocks the same level as the hotel so you get to see for quite a long way. Room service was good though on the first day we were unwelcomed by a receptionist for turning up early to the hotel (not our fault, its just that even Mussolini made the trains run on time). Restaurants nearby were not exactly haute cuisine but they were too out of the way to be any good. So for a good restaurant, you will never go wrong with going to the centre of Rome as it is not as expensive as you think. Recommended restaurants are Pizza Ciro near Spanish Steps, this is the oldest pizzaria in Rome and is very good. Sun Pizza was also very good, near Spanish Steps, ask me for exact address as i do not know off the top of my head but be sure to book for both. Nothing bad about Pinewood other than it is out of the way but the links such as bus and metro are excellent. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: danishtraveller8230
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel, in a convenient distance from the city. Bus line 49 directly from hotel to Vatican and end stop in walking distance from town centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but out of the way”
Reviews.Author: sr70
Reviews.Content: Hotel Pinewood is a great hotel - comfortable beds, some rooms have jacuzzi tubs and shower jets, balcony, extensive breakfast. It's out of the way - rather difficult to get to, but very close to the Metro line. The neighborhood is a real Roman neighborhood - good restaurants, an outdoor market, lots of shopping, everyday people - and the hotel is across the street from a park with a great view of St. Peter's Basilica. When we arrived, it was a rainy Sunday afternoon and everything was closed - we thought the neighborhood was a bit seedy. The next morning, however, we realized we were in a great area that had a lot of character. The metro is easy to use - it's about 10 minutes from the Termini station - and buses run late into the evening. Unless you want to walk out of your hotel and into the sights, this is a great hotel and a fantastic value. One tip (besides requesting a room with a jacuzzi tub): take Metro Linea A to Battistini (from Termini Station). Get off at Cornelia. Following the exit signs, you'll see three exits - take the Via Boccea exit, cross the street (towards the bus terminal) and you'll be on the road to Pinewood. If you take one of the other exits, keep your eyes open for a Hotel Pinewood sign - one side has arrows pointing you in the right direction. Or just ask for directions - the people of Rome are very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Millsx4
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at the Pinewood Hotel. Very easy access via Cornelia station and the easy bus system. Breakfast was very nice and filling. My only reccomendation would be to make sure to book a room above the first floor! The kids 'room' is nearest the hall door...we were in Room 108 near reception/ bar area and it got really noisy. Luckily we were all so tired from walking around Rome that it didn't keep any of us up. Would definitely stay again and reccomend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: HotelGuru567456
Reviews.Content: best hotel ever i love it its brill fit blokes everywhere

Reviews.Title: “Good value, ok location”
Reviews.Author: lghansen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on a business trip, and thought it was very nice. It was clean, the staff friendly, and unlike the other two hotels I stayed at in Rome on this trip, they had a folder with the information which is frequently asked, rather than me actually having to ask. Each room even had a little balcony. The location isn't the best if you are a tourist, but the price was very reasonable, and it's a 15 minute walk or short bus trip to the Cornelia Metro station which will take you downtown in almost no time, it's also as convenient to the Vatican as a hotel that's downtown. The one thing I missed was that it didn't have a refrigerator or mini bar, and I like to keep cold water in the fridge when I travel. It also had apartment buildings on both sides, so it wasn't very private if you opened your curtains or were out on the balcony. The area was also nice as it was across from a park that has a nice view of Vatican City.

Reviews.Title: “Location an unfortunate downside”
Reviews.Author: MintTea
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in late September, booked through Easytobook.com. This time of year is high season and I had to search long and hard to find a hotel of reasonable price (130 Euro/night) that wasn't miles out of the centre of Rome. There is not a lot to find fault with this hotel other than the location. The nearest Metro station (Cornelia) is, at the very least, a 10 minute walk, along a not too scenic route. After a long day's sight-seeing it feels a lot further! However, the Metro route is handy to most sites in Rome. We stayed in a 'Superior' class room (301). The room was of moderate size with a large bed and small tv with two English speaking channels (CNN and MTV). It's best feature though was the jacuzzi bath - a great way to relax at the end of a day. The room was located next to the stairwell so could at times be a bit noisey but in the main was reasonably quiet. The staff were pleasant and eager to help with directions to the sights. There was also a supermarket just 10 minutes away as we find see anywhere immediately obvious to go and eat dinner. Breakfast was a simple affair with croissants, rolls, cheese and yoghurt to choose from. Overall, this hotel is a good 3 star establishment, however the location may put you off a little if you aren't used to a lot of walking.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Princec5
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Pinewood in rome this past weekend...Really nice hotel! The staff was very helpful and very friendly. There is a small bar beside the lobby of the hotel which was a plus for all of you alcohololics lol. The rooms were very clean and nicely decorated. I had a huge bed to myself! Even though the rooms are small as well as the bathroom I still enjoyed my stay. The only downfall was that the internet connection was down in the rooms.You are about 5 minutes from the nearest Metro station. About 10-15 minutes from Vatican city. I recommend this hotel! Really enjoyed my stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a short break”
Reviews.Author: KentTraveller1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Pinewood Hotel during the Easter break. Nice, clean hotel with friendly staff. Only downfall was location and shower! To get to Central Rome its a 10 min walk or a bus ride (very frequent) to the metro then a 15-20 min ride on the metro. Found this journey to be quite tiring during my week in Rome, but for a 3 day stay it would be OK. The shower in the hotel was very small, standing room only and couldn't raise arms and legs!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: holidaylover64
Reviews.Content: Thought this hotel was excellent value for money. Recently refurbished. Although a bit outside of the city the Metro is within walking distance. The staff were very helpful. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant little find!”
Reviews.Author: chenwood
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend recently stayed at the Pinewood Hotel for a four night break. Upon arrival we were kindly greeted by the woman at the hotel's front desk (in perfect English) and given the key to our room. Our room was spacious and very clean. Our comfy double bed and the bathrooms power shower and jacuzzi bath provided some welcome relief at the end of a busy day sight-seeing. The room was tidied and returned to prestine condition every morning with new sheets being laid and fresh towels provided. Breakfast is served from 7-10 a.m every morning and although it is continental it offers something for all tastes including cakes, cereal, yoghurt, bread, cheese and ham. At maximum, the nearest metro station is a 10 minute walk from the hotel and can get you to almost all of the cities top attractions easily: Trevi Fountain, The Vatican Museum, St Peters Square and Basilica, Spanish Steps, Colessium and Pantheon to name just a few. Buying a travel card for 16E allowed us unlimited use of the metro, tram and bus services for the duration of our 4 night stay. When venturing out of an evening, sit down restaurants were few and far between within the area surrounding the hotel, although the ones we managed to find provided both excellent service and food for a reasonable price. There are numerous take-away pizzarias offering alternative dining options and the hotel bar is available until midnight providing a wide selection of alcoholic beverages if one wishes to stay close to base. Overall Pinewood Hotel is an excellent place to stay if you are holidaying in Rome and we would happily return here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thomas247
Reviews.Content: We chose the Pinewood Hotel as we had found a good deal. Although the Hotel is outside of the historical centre it not far from the metro 5 to 10 minutes walk and it’s a quick journey into the centre of Rome with the Vatican only a five minute ride away. The hotel is on a main road, fortunately the noise from the road was not a problem in the hotel, and in our room we could not hear it at all. The hotel is nice enough. We had a renovated room which was nice and a Jacuzzi bath. The room we had was spacious and very clean. Although their was building work going on this was during the day and I am confused how the previous reviewer was kept awake by the noise, there was little building activity before 9am. We found the staff were helpful and friendly. All in all the hotel was ok, It’s not a good looking hotel, but was more then adequate for our needs. The breakfast is the usual continental breakfast, rolls, croissants, cheese and meats etc. Coffee, tea and fresh juice was also available all buffet style. Everything looked fresh and was replenished as required. The hotel was 400 metres from a supermarket so you could easily stock up on drinks and snacks etc. The downside to this hotel although the area outside seemed safe in the daytime I was not happy to walk about at night. This meant having to use the car to go and find somewhere to eat. There didn’t seem to be any restaurants or bars close by which you could easily walk to. The previous reviewer said it was a basic boring bargain. It depends on what you are looking for, all we wanted was a hotel we could use as a base to explore Rome historical sites. After spending all day sight seeing when we got back to the hotel all we wanted to do was shower get changed get something to eat and then bed. If you are looking for a romantic hotel or one with lots of amenities (swimming pool, gym etc) then this hotel is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: nomad77
Reviews.Content: Good place to stay but a bit out of the way since it's in the vatican area. Between the bus stop which is about 100 ft from the hotel and the subway you can get around without any problem. We would have preferred something more central. Newly renovated rooms are adequate and the continental breakfast is average for a light start. The staff was very friendly, helpful and spoke English. The area is a bit isolated when it comes to finding a restaurant, although there are a couple of them near the bus terminal, approx. 600 ft from the hotel. Overall a good hotel for the money.

Reviews.Title: “A Basic, Boring, Bargain!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We chose the Pinewood Hotel as we found an amazing rate for it on Lastminute[--]. I looked on Trip Advisor and the reviews were mixed- but because of the price we decided to go for it. HOWEVER... The reviews were right. The hotel was ok- but not great. When we arrived at the hotel we realised we were quite far outside of the historical centre. Some people had said that the area around the hotel was nice, but it isn't. The hotel is on a main road, the famous pinewoods is a shabby green with a few trees on it and the location is basically a big bus depot and an area where the locals live. The transport links are good- the metro is very quick but it stops at 9:30. You can get a bus (number 49) from the other side of the river (near Piazza Navona)- so that wasn't too bad. But you are still at least 20 minutes away from the nearest nice place to go out in! Personally we thought it would've been more beneficial to stay closer and pay more- yes we saved allot of money, but it wasn't worth it. If the hotel had been closer it would have been better. The hotel was nice enough. We had a renovated room and a Jacuzzi bath. But the builders kept us awake and the walls are very thin, so you can hear people talking in the corridors very clearly. The staff were not helpful at all. We asked about a water park and were sent on our merry ways, only to get there and it was closed (the concierge didn't even bother to check the opening times). We came back to the hotel and then got redirected to the beach (which was a nice break from the heat of the city)... but the experience cost us over £80 and the concierge didn't even apologise! The next day we asked about transport links to the airport- no one was able to give us very good advise. We managed to get there, but no thanks to them! All in all the hotel was ok, but that's as much praise as I can give it. Its not a good looking hotel, the breakfast is pretty poor, the rooms are nice, the Jacuzzis are a bonus, the location is too far out and the staff are slack! You get what you pay for!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a 5 night stay at the Pinewood Hotel in Rome, Italy. The accomodations were very nice. There were 5 family members and we had a family room, which consisted of 2 bedrooms and one bath. The staff was very knowledgeable about the area and the bus stops and how to get around. When we arrived we were very hungry. Breakfast hours were over and that is the only meal they serve, however, they prepared a meal for us and it was the best meal we had while in Rome. My 76 year old mother was with us and did not feel well one day while we were there. She felt safe enough to stay there alone. I told the staff that she was upstairs and not feeling well and we would be gone part of the day. The staff checked on her and even got some food for her. She was very happy with the time she spent alone there. We had an early morning flight and the hotel arranged a driver to pick us up and get us to the airport on time. There is some remodeling going on, however, that did not bother us, it was on the other floors and there was no noise early in the morning or late at night. It was a very pleasant experience. Also, the breakfast was awesome. We would definitely stay there again!! Thanks for all your kindness to us. Dr. Marvin and Mildred Moore Dr. Kandace Moore and Karissa Moore AnnieWise Mizell

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Pinewood hotel around valentines day as a special treat. The hotel is miles from Ciampino airport and cost us 60 euros to get there as we arrived at night we didn't want to use the metro. We stayed on the third floor and was reasonably quiet. The breakfast was OK although continental, you could help yourself to as much as you liked. The dining room was cold as was the bar area. The hotel manager recommended a restaurant close to the hotel which was absolutely rubbish (Lo chef it is called. The food was awful and took ages to arrive (my husband and I actually ate our meals separately as it took so long). There are no other restaurants within acceptable walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned, great staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hi just got back from Rome, stayed at the Pinewood, old fashioned with 'ragrolling'paintwork and a lift that was straight out of a horror movie! No tea/coffee facilities in the room, dont get a room on the fifth floor or at the front of the hotel as although there was double glazing it was SO noisy! On a good point the room was very very clean and the staff are friendly and very helpfull a good selection at breakfast time but its continental. The hotel is a little away from restraunts the area is safe if you are with someone and is a good 10 min walk from the Metro which is easy to find and so handy(be very carefull and have eyes in the back of your head pickpockets are rife, we didnt have a problem but we knew of people who did!its the kids that are the problem)get a 4 euro day ticket and use it all day on the buses and metro. Alternatively get the number 49 bus outside the hotel to the Vatican and walk from there to all the sites, it definiatly is do able. Have a great time the sights are great!

Reviews.Title: “Strangest experience”
Reviews.Author: applevert
Reviews.Content: I actually would have written this earlier as my stay was in October 2004, but only discovered this site recently. I booked the Pinewood hotel on the Travelocity website and chose this hotel based on price and location. We have friends in Rome and needed to be near the Boccea neighbourhood. Myself and 2 sisters returned to Rome after travelling around Italy and had an early flight the next morning. The staff upon check in were friendly enough, and we were quite amused by the furnishings of the lobby. It was decorated like a Granny's living room, very outdated and worn. We weren't expecting anything fancy due to the affordable price and the room reflected this. It was small but clean, and quite basic. But this is what we were expecting. The strange part of this story begins when we check out the next morning. We had an early morning flight and our friend came to meet us the next morning at 6am to drive us to the airport. The hotel staff must not have seen him arrive and when we came down to the front desk, they accused us of having a 4th person in our room and wanted to charge us accordingly. They thought our (male)friend had stayed in the room with us. A room with 3 very small, very uncomfortable single beds! They also threatened to call the police unless we paid the extra 20 euros! Due to this very confusing misunderstanding we didn't even have time or the appetite to enjoy the breakfast that was included in the room rate. Needless to say we will not be returning. I am not accustomed to being accused of harbouring men in my hotel room! I find it all very amusing now, but it was extremely frightening and confusing at the time.

Reviews.Title: “A cheap and correct hotel according to Rome standards”
Reviews.Author: HansPfaall
Reviews.Content: What's the matter with Rome? How can be the hotels so expensive offering such a low quality rate? That's the question we wandered when comparing Rome quality/rate realitonship. For the price yoy pay in Rome for a basic hotel you can sleep in a basic or even a standard hotel in Paris, Berlin, Barcelona or even London (which are more expensive cities...) It's amazing how they can ask you 120, 130 and even 150 euros for a double room in the centre of a B&B or a very simple hotel (which in rome means noisy, filthy streets, dirty rooms and a completely lack of natural light) Taking all this into account, we elected the Pinewood Hotel just because it was cheap (75/100 euros per night included buffet breakfast) and was close to metro Cornelia. The facts (according to the web): 1. 3 stars 2. 600 mtrs from Cornelia metro station 3. Good sights of the surroundings. 4. Warming atmosphere The reality (according to my experience): 1. The 3 italian stars wouldn't be considered as a 2 star or even a hostel according to spanish laws (old fashioned builidng -specially the elevators-, small rooms, very small bathrooms, no satellite tv or mini bar... 2. The metro is 10-15 minutes walking but it stops at 9 pm for works so you'll need to take taxis after having dinner in the downtown. 3. The sights are nothing special (a park with pines, not sights of the city) 4. The staff is really usefull and charming. They do speak a lot of languages and they try to speak others similar to italian (spanish, potuguese). Concluding: be prepared to be cheated and to pay a lot of money for things they not value at all. All the city is the same so don't think about it and just enjoy Rome. Having interiorized that, the Pinewood Rome is a good option just because is cheap, quiet, the staff is kind and is not excessively far from everything (at least it has the subway near). If you can pay more (around 200 euros per night) some friends have reccomend me two hotels: Franklin Feel The Sound and Meliá Rome. Quality assured, they say. Try and tell me...

HotelInfo.Name: Pinewood Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via della pineta Sacchetti,43, 00167 Rome, Italy
